1549306180_1MvfJt4w7iUCEsraP8C8gqNHp5ZQi.body: loving this :) do you plan to increase the quantity of tracks on the playlist at some point? we need *more* tunes!

cane27 exactament! yes rotating of songs will work just as well within the 10 mb parameters. i would like to design a 21 century cuckoo clock that integrates these 4Bit melodies :) of course the cuckoo should be holographic with bright, anime-style colours! TBC!
LoL still a prototype in my sketchbook of ideas at this time :) i guess it's just a matter of time before us makers will have access to holographic technology to incorporate into our designs!

1549511316_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf.body:
https://livepeer.org/

From the livepeer homepage:

"Video Made Possible.

Open Source Video Infrastructure Services, Built On the Ethereum Blockchain.

For video engineers who need affordable, reliable video encoding, Livepeer leverages decentralization to enable use
cases and business models that were never possible via proprietary, centralized cost structures."

kaffie: livepeer is designed to provide live stream, using a live streaming protocol.

1549641944_17Dvd3j3RtTZ8z5xqUDVuc9LqNFVH.body:
from https://zeronet.io/docs/faq/

Is ZeroNet anonymous?

"It's no more anonymous than BitTorrent, but privacy (the possibility to find out who is the owner of the comment/site) will increase as the network and the sites gains more peers.

ZeroNet is made to work with anonymity networks: you can easily hide your IP using the Tor network."
i2p as a network for zeronet makes a lot of sense. will be interesting to follow how that development progresses :)

Peer discovery using DHT

Benefits:

Zeronet is a project in development. You'll resolve a l0t of your own frustration if you accept this fact.
You might be more than welcome to pitch-in & lend a hand to the development with your skillz or remain a spectator at the price of quitting your bitching in the kitchen ;)   

from a mere member of this *community* of 0-ists :)
styromaniac: then try making a constructive addition to the debate

quoting the latest zeronet official documents isn't useless - unless of course that info is now out of date. again feel free to correct if I'm wrong rather than making negative statements this is my final reply I've got better things to do with my life than get into an argument with a stranger online

thanks dude :) you've explained it far better than I did. This conversation is also reminding me that networks like i2p (& Tor for that matter) have been in development for 15 years plus & still far from finished.
